findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding the authorized addresses. The owner can enable the transactions for all users. Once the transactions are enabled the owner will not be able to disable them again.

findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the updateFees function with a high percentage value.

findings.title: TSD - Total Supply Diversion
findings.description: The total supply of a token and the balances of individual accounts are two separate concepts managed by different variables in a smart contract. However, in the contract, the amount added to the total supply does not equal the amount added to the balances, resulting in a discrepancy between the sum of balances and the total supply.

findings.title: SFO - Sell Fee Oversight
findings.description: The contract contains the `stakingEnabled` variable that, when enabled, does not account for sell fees within the `else if (isSelling) condition`. This oversight in the contract logic could lead to inconsistencies in fee application and enforcement.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, creating an inconsistency in arithmetic operations and increasing the risk of unintended consequences.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading error messages that do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if the variable swapTokensAtAmount is set to a big number, it could lead to significant price volatility for the parties involved.

findings.title: RES - Redundant Event Statement
findings.description: The contract contains some events statements that are not used in the contract's implementation.

findings.title: RRS - Redundant Require Statement
findings.description: The contract utilizes a `require` statement within the `add` function aiming to prevent overflow errors, which is redundant due to Solidity version 0.8.0 and later reverting on overflow and underflow.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: RSD - Redundant Swap Duplication
findings.description: The contract contains multiple swap methods that individually perform token swaps and transfer promotional amounts to specific addresses and features, introducing unnecessary complexity and increasing gas consumption.

findings.title: RC - Repetitive Calculations
findings.description: The contract contains methods with multiple occurrences of the same calculation being performed. The calculation is repeated without utilizing a variable to store its result, which leads to redundant code, hinders code readability, and increases gas consumption.

findings.title: RTCI - Reward Token Change Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract allows the owner to change the distribution token address using `updatePayoutToken`, but this can lead to discrepancies if the internal state of the distributor is not reset, resulting in inaccurate reward distributions or failures.

findings.title: UCL - Unoptimized Calculation Logic
findings.description: The contract performs separate calculations for buy and sell fees, subsequently adding these amounts together to determine the total swap tokens, introducing unnecessary complexity and redundancy in calculations.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure that their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.
